welcome_message:
Hello! 
Thanks a lot for your interest in the MyFoodRepo Usability Study.
welcome_message_allowed_to_chat:
Hello! I’m the MyFoodRepo assistant and I’ll be following your progress throughout the study!

Please note: the app includes a chatbot used only for logging your meals, it will not respond to questions about food or diet.
If you need information about your diet, feel free to contact me anytime by SMS at this number (+41 79 807 45 35) if you need information or advice regarding your diet. You can send up to 10 messages per day.
Many thanks for your participation in the project!
download_app_message: Below, you will find links to download the app depending on your phone's operating system
welcome_key_message: Once downloaded and launched, please enter the following key to activate the app:
welcome_final_note: Should you need any assistance during the study or if you want to retract your participation to the study, please contact us at marcel.salathe@epfl.ch. You can also simply withdraw from the study by sending the word 'studystop' to this very number. Have a good day !
goodbye_message:
Hello!
We would like to let you know that MyFoodRepo's usability study is coming to an end ! Your key will be de-activated and your access to the app will be revoked shortly.
goodbye_allowed_to_chat_message_started:
Hello!
We would like to let you know that MyFoodRepo's usability study is coming to an end ! I hope you enjoyed using the app to improve your habits and I hope I was able to be a part of your journey as well.
Your key will be de-activated and your access to the app will be revoked shortly.
never_started: Unfortunately, we will be unable to provide you with a nutritional summary for the 14-day period, as there was no recorded usage of the app during that time.
goodbye_message_email_info: You will shortly receive, via the e-mail adress you provided us with, a feedback survey regarding your experience on the application, as well as information about your upcoming nutritional summary. Please make sure to check your spam folder in case you do not receive anything in the next hours.
goodbye_final_note_message: Feel free to contact us for any follow-up question you may have, and thank you again!

hei_footnotes.footnote_d: Includes all milk products, such as fluid milk, yogurt, and cheese, and fortified soy beverages.
hei_footnotes.footnote_e: Includes seafood, nuts, seeds, soy products (other than beverages), and beans, peas, and lentils.
hei_footnotes.footnote_f: Ratio of poly- and monounsaturated fatty acids (PUFAs and MUFAs) to saturated fatty acids (SFAs).
hei_footnotes.acronyms_explanation: PUFAs = polyunsaturated fatty acids. MUFAs = monounsaturated fatty acids. SFAs = saturated fatty acids.

ai-disclaimer:
The remainder of this document contains AI-generated summaries based on the figures presented on the first page.

 While generated by AI, these summaries are informed by your dietary data from MyFoodRepo and aligned with the nutritional goals you set at the beginning of the study.

 Their aim is to help you better understand the figures and to offer clear, practical, and supportive recommendations to guide your dietary progress.
hei-calculation-disclaimer: Note: HEI scores are calculated only for days where total energy intake exceeded 1,000 kcal to ensure reliable dietary assessment.
hei-explanation:
To better understand the last row of charts, it is important to understand what the Healthy Eating Index (HEI) represents.

 The HEI is a measure of the overall quality of the diet. It consists of 13 components that reflect the main dietary recommendations for what constitutes an 'ideal' diet. These components fall into two main categories:

 - Adequacy components represent food groups, subgroups, and nutrients that should be consumed in sufficient amounts. For these components, higher scores indicate higher (and thus more desirable) intakes.

 - Moderation components reflect food groups and dietary elements that should be limited. In this case, higher scores indicate lower intakes, which is more desirable.

 Each of the 13 components is scored according to specific standards, aiming for a total score of 100 points when summed. Some dietary aspects are represented by two components, each with a maximum of 5 points, while the remaining components can each score up to 10 points.
 Below is a detailed breakdown of all the categories:
ending-mail-subject: Thank You for Participating – MyFoodRepo Usability Study Complete
ending-mail-html-body:
🎉 Thank You for your participation to the MyFoodRepo Study!

Thank you for being part of the MyFoodRepo Usability Study! As our study concludes, we sincerely appreciate your time and valuable engagement. Your contribution will be crucial for the further development of the app.

📝 Share Your Feedback

We would be incredibly grateful if you could take 10-15 minutes to complete our feedback survey. Your insights will help us to improve the app.

Complete Survey

📊 Your Personal Health Summary
You will receive your personalized health summary from the past 14 days via email within the next few days.

We wish you all the best and hope you found the study interesting!

Warm regards,

The MyFoodRepo Study Team
report-mail-subject: Your Personal Nutrition Summary – MyFoodRepo Study
report-mail-html-body:
📊 Your Personal Nutrition Summary

We're pleased to share your personalized nutrition summary based on your 14-day participation in the MyFoodRepo study. This comprehensive report provides insights into your dietary patterns and nutritional intake during the study period.

📎 Your Nutrition Report

Please find your detailed nutrition summary attached to this email as a PDF document.

📋 What's Included in Your Report:

  • Macronutrient breakdown (proteins, carbohydrates, fats)
  • Meal frequency and size patterns
  • Evaluation of the overall diet quality
  • Personalized recommendations and summaries

ℹ️ Disclaimer: The report will only include an evaluation of overall diet quality if enough days with an intake above 1000 kCal have been recorded during the study period.

⚠️ Important Note:
This summary should not replace professional medical or dietary advice. Please consult with healthcare professionals for personalized nutrition guidance.

💡 Would you like to continue using the app? MyFoodRepo is now available to the general public – visit www.myfoodrepo.ai/en to learn more about our monthly subscription service. Please note that your study data cannot be transferred to a public subscription.

Thank you again for your valuable participation in our study!

Best regards,

The MyFoodRepo Research Team

Questions? Contact us at: marcel.salathe@epfl.ch
